titleStmt.title: Panoplia, or, Armour of proof for a weak Christian, against the worlds envy, scoffs and reproaches together with the doves innocency and the serpents subtility, upon Gen. 3. 15. / by R.J. [sic]
titleStmt.author: Younge, Richard.

notesStmt.note: Date of publication from Wing (2nd ed.).
Attributed to Richard Younge by WIng (2nd ed.).
Running title: A glasse for scorners, or, Instruction to prevent destruction.
"At the Blew Pales, over against the High Constables short of Shoreditch Church; where is a Glasse Lanthorn in the Window: such as please may have them." -- p. 36.
Imperfect: stained, worn, and tightly bound.
Reproduction of original in: Bodleian Library.
